resource.chars:
Light. I am not well acquainted with the literature
of this subject, but I think determinations
thus made are new. If these had been communicated
to the Society in a form which allowed of their
being printed on one page of their Transactions, I
should have recommended the printing of them.

The historical part is entirely unfir for the 
Transactions, although it might be valuable in a 
scientific periodical of lower pretensions. The elementary 
instrumental and graphical parts are unfor for
either, though they might be useful in a manual
for uninformed travellers who desire to assist
science.
I do not recommend that the Paper be printed
in the Philosophical Transactions.

I am, my dear Sir,
Yours very truly
G.B.Airy

I return the paper by carrier to Mr. Weld

490
